alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 8:04PM CST until February 19 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Alabama, including the following counties, Colbert and Lauderdale. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 754 PM CST, between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Recent heavy rainfall in northwestern Colbert county and central Lauderdale county produced some flooding with water covering the roadway at the intersection of highway 157 and CR 57. Though heavier rainfall has ended, additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible with lingering lighter rainfall in these areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Florence, Cherokee, St. Florian, Underwood-Petersville, Oakland, Threet, Wright, Zip City, Mt Hester, Riverton, Margerum, Malone, Allsboro and Green Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
